page.title: 04Changing times in Staverton
page.content: Lots of things have changed in Staverton. Like when Mrs Webb first moved in there were no street lights and she said it was creepy if you wanted to go somewhereat night . Mr Warner from the Staverton Stores said that the number of young children has dropped and the number of older people has increased. Mrs Webb from the Staverton Sub Post Office said that 40 to 60 people collect their old age pension and 20 to 30 collect their family allowance. The school numbers have got lower but now children from Catesby and Helidon come to the school. In Staverton there used to be three shops but now there is only one.There used to be two pubs but now there is one.
